item.title: 1,000,000 Miles of Metro Ethernet Fiber And Growing
item.description:
Don’t assume Metro Ethernet is a small, insignificant service. XO Communications alone has a vast network of metro fiber, connecting thousands of buildings. And that’s just one provider, not even counting Ethernet over Copper options. Metro Ethernet and its long-distance counterpart, Carrier Ethernet, are the future of telecommunications. The world is shifting from traditional circuit-based communication to packet-based IP networks. item.description:

item.title: Ethernet Bandwidth is Downright Cheap
item.description:
Business bandwidth solutions are significantly more expensive than residential options like DSL or Cable. While this is partly due to their guaranteed reliability and dedicated lines, another factor is the complex infrastructure involved. Providing business-grade services often requires collaboration between a long-haul carrier and the local phone company for the final connection. Despite recent price drops in dedicated T1 connections, high-bandwidth services remain costly, potentially hindering smaller companies needing to transmit large amounts of data...

item.title: Trade In Your T1 Line For 10 Mbps Ethernet
item.description:
If your T1 line contract is expiring soon or has already ended and you’re on a month-to-month plan, don’t rush to renew. You might be able to obtain a 10 Mbps Ethernet connection for the same price. It might seem implausible to get 10 Mbps for the price of 1.5 Mbps at the same location, given that business telecom pricing is based on bandwidth and distance.
